Detailed Description

Tree node for the if..then..else construct from the language. The contents of the node is broken down into three parts with one child node for each - the conditional expression, the "then" body and finally the "else" body. Both the "then" and "else" child nodes are of the type CRootTreeNode which contains the statements making up the respective bodies. If the statement was written without using "else", there will still be a child node to represent it, but it will not have any children.

Children:
   0. Condition expression
   1. Body of the if statement.
   2. Body of the else statement.

CTreeNode * CIfStmtTreeNode::RewriteIntoMIRForm ( CTreeNode *  Stmts  )  [virtual]

Perform the simplification of all children - the conditional, if body and else body. When processing the two bodies it's a recursive process to handle each statement in turn.
